AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: individuals being smuggled into the United States, transported in a hidden van compartment using pinatas as cover
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.five undocumented aliens: undocumented immigrants being smuggled, transported in a hidden van compartment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfredo Ortega-Chavez: defendant in a trial related to smuggling, subject to disclosure of witness information, implicated by Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's deposition testimony

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's mother: rebuttal witness testifying against Alfredo Ortega-Chavez's alibi
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Government Attorney: prosecutor in the case against Alfredo Ortega-Chavez, responsible for disclosing witness information
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's father and Ramo: rebuttal witnesses whose testimony confirmed Alfredo Ortega-Chavez was in Sabinas Hidalgo on November 22, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ms. Salinas' law firm: law firm representing Alfredo Ortega-Chavez, obliged to resist judicial partiality and eschew baseless charges, introduced Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's deposition testimony as evidence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge Kazen: judge presiding over Alfredo Ortega-Chavez's trial, maintained impartiality and conducted proceedings fairly and competently, made a statement regarding the swearing of witnesses
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mrs. Guerrero: juror in Alfredo Ortega-Chavez's trial with potential conflict of interest due to friendship with a lawyer, deemed capable of remaining impartial by Judge Kazen

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez: accomplice witness whose testimony revealed inconsistencies but was not incredible as a matter of law, provided deposition testimony implicating Alfredo Ortega-Chavez
